description: Change of use to ground floor of No. 86 from retail shop (A1 Use Class) to place of worship (D1 Use Class); single storey rear extension for place of worship (D1 Use Class) at Nos. 82 & 84 including associated cycle storage and refuse storage provision (following demolition of single storey rear extensions); and installation of new shopfronts (Joint Application)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development permitted is approved in accordance with drawing title number(s) M01, received Site Location Map 1-1250 ref. 1055 M01, received 29 November 2017; Block Plan 1-500 as Proposed ref. 1055 M02, received 29 November 2017; Floor Plans / Elevations as Existing ref. E01, received 04 July 2017; Proposed Floor Plans ref. 1055 100 rev E, received 24 November 2017; Elevations as Proposed ref. 1055 200 rev E, received 24 November 2017.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, the roof lights are to be fixed shut and non-openable, and the glazed roof is to be screened with an automatic roller blind before 6am and after 11pm.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the surrounding residential development, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Noise mitigation measures shall be installed in the ceiling between the development hereby approved and the dwellings above, and between the development hereby approved and the adjacent residences to achieve an acoustic standard of NR 25 Leq 5 mins (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5 mins (one-third octaves) inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq 5 mins (octaves) or NR 25 Leq 5 mins (one-third octaves) inside a habitable room when noise is generated from the commercial use.  The mitigation measures shall be implemented prior to the commencement of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the occupiers of the above residential premises and adjacent residential premises, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| No amplified voice, music or other sound shall be permitted within the development hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason:  In the interests of the living conditions of the occupiers of the above residential premises and adjacent residential premises, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 No.596 the development shall only be used for the D1 use hereby permitted and not for any other use.
Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the provision of social infrastructure uses, in accordance with policies 3.16 and 3.19 of the London Plan (2016).
| Ensure refuse and recycling storage, and sheltered and secure cycle storage  are provided and brought into use prior to commencement of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure adequate arrangements are provided for the storage and collection of refuse and recycables, and cycle parking is provided within the development in accordance with policies 5.16 and 6.9 of the London Plan (2016); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG (2012).

| The use of the building shall be as a place of worship (D1) and the hours of operation at the building shall be from 6am to 11pm, except during the Islamic month of Ramadan, whereby the hours of operation shall be permitted in accordance with those hours issued by the Regent's Park Mosque.  During the Islamic Month of Ramadan the use of the building shall be restricted to a maximum of ten people on site at any time for the duration of the hours before 6am and after 11pm.
Reason:  To safeguard the amenity of adjacent residents and the area generally, in accordance with policies with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
